section.title: Overview
section.p: All the words are analysed with dictionary form + grammatical tags. Each tag is introduced with a "+" sign. We thus have

biila+N+Sg+Acc
boahtit+V+Ind+Prs+Sg1
The following tags are defined in the lexicon file (in the beginning of the sme-lex.txt file, and correspondingly, with other tags, for the other languages):
section.source:

section.p: The reason why there is a Multichar_Symbols section is that without it, lexc (the morphological program) would have treated them as separate letters (+Pron as +, P, r, o and n) instead of as tags. Since all tags are marked with an initial "+", all grammatical tags are found in the list. Note that in order to disambiguate text (with the program vislcg), we strip the pluses and instead represent the words as "<biilla> N Sg Acc" instead.

Note that the derivational tags "represent themselves", i.e., words derived with the suffix "-laš" will get the tag +laš, etc. Another possibility šould have been to declare a tag "+Der/laš". This has been done for Lule Sámi.
These are the main parts of speech (POS) for Northern Sámi:
Nouns, adjectives, verbs, pronouns, adverbs, particles, subjunctions, conjunctions, adpositions, postpositions, prepositions and interjections.

section.title: The nouns
section.p: The string is "+N+Number+Case+Possessivesuffix+Clitic". The word form "biilasgo" is thus analysed as "biila+N+Sg+Gen+PxSg3+Clt".

section.title: The pronouns
section.p: The personal, demonstrative and interrogative pronouns:
baseform+Pron+Pers+Number+Case
Example:

mun+Pron+Pers+Sg+Com
dat+Pron+Dem+Pl+Nom
The reflexive pronouns:
baseform+Pron+pronoun_type+Case(+possessive suffix)
Example: ies1+Pron+Refl+Loc+PxDu1
